com.github.marandus.argval

Class ArgumentValidatorBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.marandus.argval.ArgumentValidatorBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollectionArgumentValidator, NumberArgumentValidator, ObjectArgumentValidator, StringArgumentValidator

    public class ArgumentValidatorBean
extends Object
implements CollectionArgumentValidator, NumberArgumentValidator, ObjectArgumentValidator, StringArgumentValidator
    An implementation of the argument validator that may be used as a bean in other applications. It could be, for example, registered with a Spring application context or other similar solutions. This class implements all validator interfaces but simply forwards the calls to the corresponding internal validator instances.
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Thomas Rix (thomasrix@exodus-project.net)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentValidatorBean

        public ArgumentValidatorBean()
        Create a new validator bean instance. Uses the reference implementations of CollectionArgumentValidator, ObjectArgumentValidator, and StringArgumentValidator.
        See Also:
        CollectionArgumentValidatorImpl, ObjectArgumentValidatorImpl, StringArgumentValidatorImpl

      • ArgumentValidatorBean

        public ArgumentValidatorBean(CollectionArgumentValidator collArgVal,
                             NumberArgumentValidator numArgVal,
                             ObjectArgumentValidator objArgVal,
                             StringArgumentValidator stringArgVal)
        Create a new validator bean instance. Uses the specified custom implementations of CollectionArgumentValidator, ObjectArgumentValidator, and StringArgumentValidator.
        Parameters:
        collArgVal - Custom implementation of collection validator
        numArgVal - Custom implementation of number validator
        objArgVal - Custom implementation of object validator
        stringArgVal - Custom implementation of string validator

    • Method Detail

      • requireNonBlank

        public void requireNonBlank(String arg,
                            String msg)
        Test arg to be non-blank as defined by the StringUtils#isBlank(java.lang.CharSequence) method. If arg is blank, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        msg + ": " + arg

        Specified by:
        requireNonBlank in interface StringArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        msg - Message used to construct the exception message

      • requireLength

        public void requireLength(String arg,
                          int len,
                          NumberCompareOperator comp,
                          String name)
        Test the length of arg against the provided length using the specified compare operator. If the result of the comparison is false, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "String length violation (" + name + "): string(" + arg.length() + ") " + comp.getOperator() + " " + len

        Specified by:
        requireLength in interface StringArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - String to test
        len - Value to be used as reference in comparison
        comp - Comparison operator to be used
        name - Name to be referenced in exception message

      • requireNonNull

        public void requireNonNull(Object arg,
                           String msg)
        Test arg to be non-null as defined by the Objects#isNull(java.lang.Object) method. If arg is null, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "NULL: " + msg

        Specified by:
        requireNonNull in interface ObjectArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        msg - Message used to construct the exception message

      • requireNonEmpty

        public void requireNonEmpty(Collection<?> arg,
                            String msg)
        Test arg to be non-null and not empty. If the collection is null or empty, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        msg + ": Collection is empty"

        Specified by:
        requireNonEmpty in interface CollectionArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        msg - Message used to construct the exception message

      • requireNonEmpty

        public void requireNonEmpty(Map<?,?> arg,
                            String msg)
        Test arg to be non-null and not empty. If the map is null or empty, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        msg + ": Map is empty"

        Specified by:
        requireNonEmpty in interface CollectionArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        msg - Message used to construct the exception message

      • requireLength

        public void requireLength(Collection<?> arg,
                          int len,
                          NumberCompareOperator comp,
                          String name)
        Test the size of arg, as defined by Collection.size(), against the provided length using the specified compare operator. If the result of the comparison is false, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "Collection size violation (" + name + "): Collection(" + arg.size() + ") " + comp.getOperator() + " " + len

        Specified by:
        requireLength in interface CollectionArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Collection to test
        len - Value to be used as reference in comparison
        comp - Comparison operator to be used
        name - Name to be referenced in exception message

      • requireLength

        public void requireLength(Map<?,?> arg,
                          int len,
                          NumberCompareOperator comp,
                          String name)
        Test the size of arg, as defined by Map.size(), against the provided length using the specified compare operator. If the result of the comparison is false, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "Map size violation (" + name + "): Map(" + arg.size() + ") " + comp.getOperator() + " " + len

        Specified by:
        requireLength in interface CollectionArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Map to test
        len - Value to be used as reference in comparison
        comp - Comparison operator to be used
        name - Name to be referenced in exception message

      • requireValue

        public void requireValue(byte arg,
                         byte value,
                         NumberCompareOperator comp,
                         String name)
        Test the comparison of arg and value using the operator defined in comp to be true. If the result of the comparison is false, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "Byte value violation (" + name + "): byte(" + arg + ") " + comp.getOperator() + " " + value

        Specified by:
        requireValue in interface NumberArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        value - Value to be used as reference in comparison
        comp - Comparison operator to be used
        name - Name to be referenced in exception message

      • requireNegative

        public void requireNegative(long arg,
                            String name)
        Test the value of arg to be less than zero. If the value is zero or greater, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "Value is not negative (" + name + "): " + arg

        Specified by:
        requireNegative in interface NumberArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test

        "Value is not positive (" + name + "): " + arg

        Specified by:
        requirePositive in interface NumberArgumentValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - Argument to test
        name - Name to be referenced in exception message

      • requireZero

        public void requireZero(long arg,
                        String name)
        Test the value of arg to be zero. If the value is greater or less than zero, an IllegalArgumentException will be raised. The exception message will be constructed as follows:

        "Value is not zero (" + name + "): " + arg

        Specified by:
